head.supplied: June 24 [186]8 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to inform you that the enclosed letter was received and laid before the Council yesterday. The Council do not think it necessary to trouble to trouble ¶ th...

div.p: Unit 5, p. 718, VPRS 2225 outward letterpress copy books, Acclimatisation Society of Victoria, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
I have the honor to inform you that the enclosed letter was received and laid before the Council yesterday. The Council do not think it necessary to trouble to trouble
Words repeated. the Trustees about the matter but a
as? it is addressed to the Trustees will you kindly reply to it stating that owing to the state of the Society's funds in consequence of the non receipt of the Government grant the Society is not able to afford any money in repairing the roads in the Royal Park. The Council [will] gladly avail themselves of the cooperation of the Borough Council of Brunswick to solicit a portion of the grant for the improvement of parks when that grant is about to be distributed.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be

div.p: To Dr F von Mueller F.R.S
Hony Secretary to Trustees of Royal Park
